summary: Tony: This is the most stupid, irresponsible, dangerous thing you have ever done! Is this what you want? Will we have to...
body:
Tony: This is the most stupid, irresponsible, dangerous thing you have ever done! Is this what you want? Will we have to identify your charred bodies through their dental records? I want a straight answer! Who did this?

Peter: Wade did it!

Wade: Peter did it!

Matt: …

Peter: I didn’t do it!

Wade: I didn’t do it!

Clint: We’re going to the dentist?

summary:
Tony: *walks into the room*
Peter, to Stephen: remember what we rehearsed, Doctor Dad. This flirting method is guaranteed...
body:
Tony: *walks into the room*

Peter, to Stephen: remember what we rehearsed, Doctor Dad. This flirting method is guaranteed effective.

Stephen: Tony, I just wanted to let you know that you make my hotel trivago.

Tony: … thanks babe.

Tony, internally: I have no fucking clue what that means

summary:
OK but what if Morgan stark taught herself to read and then is just like the biggest pain in the arse about it?!
The sexy notes...
body:
OK but what if Morgan stark taught herself to read and then is just like the biggest pain in the arse about it?!

The sexy notes Daddy would Leave on top of Mommy’s to do list? Oh guess whos now asking what a kink is?

Asking Jarvis to bring up all the stories on Daddy and then gaining leverage in any argument. Oh you won’t let me stay up late you stayed up and had parties?!

Slowly sounding out each new curse word with a annoying childish glee that makes Tony wince each time she gets into his Emails.

summary: If Marvel thinks I'm gonna walk back up into that theater and spend more money on this movie and watch this re-release of...
body:
If Marvel thinks I’m gonna walk back up into that theater and spend more money on this movie and watch this re-release of Endgame because of some new footage and knowing the outcome is still gonna be the same with Tony and Nat sacrificing themselves for a better world…

YOU’RE ABSO-FUCKING-LUTELY CORRECT I WILL PUT MYSELF THROUGH THAT EMOTIONAL PAIN AGAIN!

@enby-in-fandom @grellaofasgard @assbutt-still-in-hell @miasif

blog.name: khentkawes
blog.title: I wander through fiction...ooh, look, a squirrel!
blog.description: Aggressively multifandom. Lots of Britishness and sci-fi/fantasy. Current fanish foci: Tony Stark / RDJ - BBC Musketeers - Doctor Who / Peter Capaldi / David Tennant - Killjoys - Santiago Cabrera - Tom Hiddleston / Loki

body:
https://variety.com/2019/film/news/avengers-endgame-rerelease-avatar-box-office-record-1203247314/

“If you stay and watch the movie, after the credits, there’ll be a deleted scene, a little tribute, and a few surprises.” - Kevin Feige

*big sigh*

I am less excited about this than they want me to be.

So, full disclosure, I only saw Endgame once and I was actually planning to see it one more time in the next week or two (partially as research for fixit-fic, partially to see if I like it any better after I’ve had time top process the grief of it, and partially because it would be cool for Endgame to beat Avatar’s record). But now, I like…kind of don’t want to? It’s just that now it feels like we’re being manipulated into making the movie beat Avatar’s record and that feels kinda shitty, I guess? Especially after all of the stupid-ass comments from the Russos and Markus & McFeely that make it seem like they don’t care about fans at all, and then to pull this out to make us go see the movie again? Honestly, I wasn’t surprised because it’s a business decision that a lot of people expected, but it still feels manipulative.

But even more so…gosh, I’m expecting that “deleted scene” to be something awful. I mean, it’s not going to be a scene that reveals that Tony Stark is alive and well, and living a secret retirement. If it was, I would forgive everything and happily trot out to the theater multiple times. But it won’t be that.

So barring that, what are the options that would be worth it:

  • if the “tribute” is some kind of tribute to Nat and Tony together
  • a new shawarma scene: it can take place mid-way through Endgame, that’s fine, but a clear homage to that scene with the team laughing and talking and enjoying each others company (because we didn’t get enough of that in Endgame)
  • a bunch of scenes of the Avengers messing around and joking while testing the time travel device (because, again, we didn’t get enough of the team being a team)
  • an afterlife/soul stone scene where Tony sees Yinsen, who tells Tony how proud he is that Tony didn’t waste one second of his life.
  • an afterlife/soul stone scene where Natasha greets Tony and they say, “we won,” before walking off into the orangey sunset together
  • something with Tony and Pepper would be good. Or Tony and Rhodey. But I can’t envision what they would have filmed that would work as a post-credits-scene.

And that’s it. Those are the only good options I can think of that would make this worthwhile to me. That doesn’t mean I won’t go and see it (I probably will, since I was planning to anyway), but… I’m not as optimistic as I would like to be.

*Tony flirts with Steve*
Bucky: if you don't stop hitting on my boyfriend you will feel my wrath.
Tony: I'm not hitting on your...
body:
*Tony flirts with Steve*

Bucky: if you don’t stop hitting on my boyfriend you will feel my wrath.

Tony: I’m not hitting on your boyfriend.

Steve: And I am not your boyfriend

Sam: And you have no wrath.

by DarkKnightArkham

The empty feeling of an impending threat never left after the battle. And Steve would soon learn why, when he stumbled upon a stray katana, snapped in half, and a pool of blood not far away. Turns out the universe thought they hadn’t lost enough, and Tony wasn’t the only sacrifice.

Words: 1922, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

  • Fandoms: The Avengers (Marvel Movies)
  • Rating: Not Rated
  • Warnings: Graphic Depictions Of Violence, Major Character Death

blog.name: justabigassnerd
blog.title: Big Ass Nerd
blog.description: I write for musicals, Marvel (potentially more I just can't think of any atm) I will not write smut REQUESTS: OPEN

title: We all care about you
body:
Pairing - Avengers x teen!reader

Word count - 1,200

Warnings - violence, swearing

A/N - This was a request sent in by an anon and it was a challenge to write as the reader in this fic is diabetic and the only experience I have with diabetes is my dog. (Yes I have a diabetic dog) so this took a great deal of research and I just hope this fic is ok. As usual guys, please send in requests and enjoy!

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

“Alright guys, you know the plan, kill the Chitauri and take down Loki.” Steve says as the other six Avengers suit up to get ready to fight in the city of New York where Loki has opened a huge wormhole using the Tesseract to allow the Chitauri to filter in and wreak havoc among the streets. With you being the youngest of the Avengers, and the fact you’re diabetic, these two factors lead to the other Avengers being immensely overprotective over you, each other them viewing you as their own child. They had noticed that you were slightly anxious as you sorted out your weapons and Clint had noticed your hands shaking as you loaded your gun but brushed it off as you just being nervous about the upcoming battle. You all head into the city and help to get any civilians out of the line of fire while holding off the aliens, you stick to the areas that are more populated with people than aliens to help them to keep them and yourself safe, knowing the team would go ape shit should anything happen to you. As you finish clearing the last remaining people out of the area and shooting down a few Chitauri you start to feel dizzy and you know that your blood sugar is getting low and you need to do something about it. You stumble into an abandoned building, leaning on the wall for support as you fumble in your suit, hoping to find a packet of gummy bears or some kind of sweet to bring your blood sugar levels up enough to finish the fight. You start to feel anxiety build in your stomach as you can’t find anything, you forgot to pack a snack in your suit, you were so worried about this battle you forgot one of the most important things for you. You start to feel your energy draining and you drag yourself behind a counter to hide yourself from any Chitauri that may investigate the area before allowing your tired eyes to slowly close.

“JARVIS, do you know where the kid is? I haven’t seen her at all during this fight.” Tony says to his AI, growing worried as he’s seen every member of the team besides you, allowing him to jump to conclusions and assume the worst already.

“Sir, it appears that Miss y/n has fallen unconscious.” That sentence alone basically gave Tony heart palpitations.

“JARVIS, where the fuck is she? I need her location. Now.” Tony demands, trying to keep his breathing under control and listen to where JARVIS tells him to go. When he finds your location, he enters the building and finds you slumped against the counter. He wastes no time scooping you up in his arms and moving you to some place safe, opting to not take you to the tower in case of it being attacked and instead taking you to a hospital. Once Loki had been defeated, the rest of the Avengers start to notice you’re missing and start to ask where you are. Natasha catches on to the fact that Tony isn’t as concerned as everyone else, meaning he must know where you are.

“Stark, where’s y/n?” Steve says, walking up to Tony, trying to keep his emotions in check and not show the fear he has in you potentially being hurt, or worse.

“Come with me.” Tony says simply, taking them to the hospital and walking up to the receptionist with the five other Avengers stood right behind him.

“I need to see y/n l/n please.” He says to the woman who barely glances up at him before typing in your name onto her computer to find out your room number.

“Room 242, 3rd floor, are you family?” She responds in a monotonous tone which makes Tony roll his eyes slightly and sigh under his breath.

“Yeah, we’re her family.” He responds before he and the rest of the team get into a lift and once they arrive on the third floor, start to search for your room. Clint is the one to find your room and waves his hand wildly to get their attention, so he doesn’t shout and disturb any other patients nearby. He opens the door and walks in slowly, jumping slightly when he sees a nurse in there with you. She notices the presence of the Avengers and looks up and smiles at them all.

“Are you her family?” She asks, barely batting an eyelid at all of them, bar Tony and Bruce, still being in their superhero suits. When they nod, she looks back at you to check you charts before leaving your bedside.

“She should be waking up soon, she passed out from her blood sugar getting too low, she should be fine and just make sure to give her snacks in case of her blood sugar getting too low.” The nurse says before leaving the room, allowing the Avengers to take their seat by your side. They didn’t have to wait around long though as after about an hour of them sitting around they saw you move and slowly open your eyes, adjusting to the bright light of the hospital.

“Hey guys.” You mumble, smiling at them slightly as they all smile back at you.

“Hey kid, you feeling ok?” Clint says, quickly shifting into father mode. Wanting to make sure that you’re ok, when you nod lightly, he settles down in his seat slightly, being put at ease. All of them fall silent for a split second before Bruce speaks up.

“Why didn’t you tell someone you forgot snacks? We could’ve found a way to get something over to you quickly.” He says lightly, shuffling his chair slightly closer to address you properly.

“I knew you guys were too busy saving the world to worry about me so I just fought until I couldn’t anymore.” You say, avoiding eye contact with any of the team who all glance at each other with worry filled eyes, hating the fact you thought you weren’t important to them.

“y/n, you are so vital to the team, you helped the remaining civilians escape that we hadn’t noticed were still in the city. We all love and care about you so much, we can’t imagine what we’d do if something happened to you.” Nat says softly, making you look up at her and look around at the team who have looks of genuine care and worry in their eyes.

“We all worry about you, with the fact you’re a member of the Avengers and your diabetes, we care a lot about you and don’t want anything to happen to you. We all see you as our own kid and we all love you” Steve says, looking down at you and smiling which you return gratefully. They then all decide to have a group hug and trap you in the middle which you laugh about but enjoyed all the same. You loved this team with your entire heart. Yes, they could be overprotective and overbearing sometimes but you knew they truly care for you and that’s all that mattered to you. You wouldn’t trade the team for the world.

(Yes I have a diabetic dog) so this took a great deal of research and I just hope this fic is ok. As usual guys, please send in requests and enjoy!

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

“Alright guys, you know the plan, kill the Chitauri and take down Loki.” Steve says as the other six Avengers suit up to get ready to fight in the city of New York where Loki has opened a huge wormhole using the Tesseract to allow the Chitauri to filter in and wreak havoc among the streets. With you being the youngest of the Avengers, and the fact you’re diabetic, these two factors lead to the other Avengers being immensely overprotective over you, each other them viewing you as their own child. They had noticed that you were slightly anxious as you sorted out your weapons and Clint had noticed your hands shaking as you loaded your gun but brushed it off as you just being nervous about the upcoming battle. You all head into the city and help to get any civilians out of the line of fire while holding off the aliens, you stick to the areas that are more populated with people than aliens to help them to keep them and yourself safe, knowing the team would go ape shit should anything happen to you. As you finish clearing the last remaining people out of the area and shooting down a few Chitauri you start to feel dizzy and you know that your blood sugar is getting low and you need to do something about it. You stumble into an abandoned building, leaning on the wall for support as you fumble in your suit, hoping to find a packet of gummy bears or some kind of sweet to bring your blood sugar levels up enough to finish the fight. You start to feel anxiety build in your stomach as you can’t find anything, you forgot to pack a snack in your suit, you were so worried about this battle you forgot one of the most important things for you. You start to feel your energy draining and you drag yourself behind a counter to hide yourself from any Chitauri that may investigate the area before allowing your tired eyes to slowly close.

[[MORE]]

“JARVIS, do you know where the kid is? I haven’t seen her at all during this fight.” Tony says to his AI, growing worried as he’s seen every member of the team besides you, allowing him to jump to conclusions and assume the worst already.

“Sir, it appears that Miss y/n has fallen unconscious.” That sentence alone basically gave Tony heart palpitations.

“JARVIS, where the fuck is she? I need her location. Now.” Tony demands, trying to keep his breathing under control and listen to where JARVIS tells him to go. When he finds your location, he enters the building and finds you slumped against the counter. He wastes no time scooping you up in his arms and moving you to some place safe, opting to not take you to the tower in case of it being attacked and instead taking you to a hospital. Once Loki had been defeated, the rest of the Avengers start to notice you’re missing and start to ask where you are. Natasha catches on to the fact that Tony isn’t as concerned as everyone else, meaning he must know where you are.

“Stark, where’s y/n?” Steve says, walking up to Tony, trying to keep his emotions in check and not show the fear he has in you potentially being hurt, or worse.

“Come with me.” Tony says simply, taking them to the hospital and walking up to the receptionist with the five other Avengers stood right behind him.

“I need to see y/n l/n please.” He says to the woman who barely glances up at him before typing in your name onto her computer to find out your room number.

“Room 242, 3rd floor, are you family?” She responds in a monotonous tone which makes Tony roll his eyes slightly and sigh under his breath.

“Yeah, we’re her family.” He responds before he and the rest of the team get into a lift and once they arrive on the third floor, start to search for your room. Clint is the one to find your room and waves his hand wildly to get their attention, so he doesn’t shout and disturb any other patients nearby. He opens the door and walks in slowly, jumping slightly when he sees a nurse in there with you. She notices the presence of the Avengers and looks up and smiles at them all.

“Are you her family?” She asks, barely batting an eyelid at all of them, bar Tony and Bruce, still being in their superhero suits. When they nod, she looks back at you to check you charts before leaving your bedside.

“She should be waking up soon, she passed out from her blood sugar getting too low, she should be fine and just make sure to give her snacks in case of her blood sugar getting too low.” The nurse says before leaving the room, allowing the Avengers to take their seat by your side. They didn’t have to wait around long though as after about an hour of them sitting around they saw you move and slowly open your eyes, adjusting to the bright light of the hospital.

“Hey guys.” You mumble, smiling at them slightly as they all smile back at you.

“Hey kid, you feeling ok?” Clint says, quickly shifting into father mode. Wanting to make sure that you’re ok, when you nod lightly, he settles down in his seat slightly, being put at ease. All of them fall silent for a split second before Bruce speaks up.

“Why didn’t you tell someone you forgot snacks? We could’ve found a way to get something over to you quickly.” He says lightly, shuffling his chair slightly closer to address you properly.

“I knew you guys were too busy saving the world to worry about me so I just fought until I couldn’t anymore.” You say, avoiding eye contact with any of the team who all glance at each other with worry filled eyes, hating the fact you thought you weren’t important to them.

“y/n, you are so vital to the team, you helped the remaining civilians escape that we hadn’t noticed were still in the city. We all love and care about you so much, we can’t imagine what we’d do if something happened to you.” Nat says softly, making you look up at her and look around at the team who have looks of genuine care and worry in their eyes.

“We all worry about you, with the fact you’re a member of the Avengers and your diabetes, we care a lot about you and don’t want anything to happen to you. We all see you as our own kid and we all love you” Steve says, looking down at you and smiling which you return gratefully. They then all decide to have a group hug and trap you in the middle which you laugh about but enjoyed all the same. You loved this team with your entire heart. Yes, they could be overprotective and overbearing sometimes but you knew they truly care for you and that’s all that mattered to you. You wouldn’t trade the team for the world.

We all love and care about you so much, we can’t imagine what we’d do if something happened to you.” Nat says softly, making you look up at her and look around at the team who have looks of genuine care and worry in their eyes.

We all see you as our own kid and we all love you” Steve says, looking down at you and smiling which you return gratefully. They then all decide to have a group hug and trap you in the middle which you laugh about but enjoyed all the same. You loved this team with your entire heart.
